variables.name: SHE-MELT-MIB::sheMeltTestRequestControlReqTimeStamp

description: The MELT status of this port.
A MELT test or test tone insertion may only be performed on
one port on a given IU at any one time. This restriction does
not apply to ports on different IUs, for which MELT/test tone
insertion may be performed at the same time.
The columnar object sheMeltTestRequestIuState reports the
test status for the IU card on which the port is located.
A MELT test (startMeltTest(2)) or test tone insertion
(activateTestTone(4)) may be performed, only if no other port
is being tested, i.e., only when
Whenever a port on the IU is under test, the columnar object
the port on the IU currently under test.
Wetting current injection at the port will be automatically
interrupted for the duration of the test (MELT or test tone).
(Configuration of wetting current injection is made via the
Insertion of a test tone will be terminated automatically
idle(1) : no test running and no test has been
started since the last reset of the
applyingTestTone(3) : test tone activated on line
idleTestSucceeded(5): line idle and the last MELT
idleTestAborted(6) : line idle and the last MELT
or there was an internal failure
applyingTestTone(3) : test tone activated on line
variables.name: SHE-MELT-MIB::sheMeltTestRequestIfState

description: The MELT status of IU on which the port represented by the
Each table entry reports the test status of the
IU on which the associated port is located, so that it can
easily been determined, whether a MELT test or test tone
insertion for this port may be started.
If a port on the IU is already under test, the columnar
MELT/test tone insertion may be performed on ports
located on different IUs at the same time.
idle(1) : no port located on this IU is
beingTested(2) : a port located on this IU is already
-> no new test may be started
applyingTestTone(3) : a test tone is currently activated on
a port located on this IU
-> no new test may be started
variables.name: SHE-MELT-MIB::sheMeltTestRequestIuState

description: This alarm is raised when the MELT subsystem detects a
general hardware fault on the MELT card as a result of the
- during initialization of the line card
- on demand via SNMP (startMeltCardSelfTest(20)) or CLI
- at the execution of each MELT test
This alarm may be raised in addition to a

Summary.eval: ($v4==5) ? 'MELT card hardware fault cleared' : 'MELT card hardware fault'

description: Indicates the type or class of reporting source for the alarm.
Reporting source type determines how sheAlarmReportingSource
is to be interpreted. See sheAlarmReportingSourceType for a
A sheAlarmSeverityProfileEntry can be assigned to each
sheAlarmReportingSourceType within the MIB associated with
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmReportingSourceType

description: Values 1..4 indicate that the alarm of the given severity has
been raised, the actual severity used being dependent on the
Value 5 indicates that the alarm has been cleared.
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmSeverity

description: This alarm is raised when the MELT subsystem detects that
calibration data is not available on a MELT card.
Calibration data is generated for all ports during card
production to compensate for the variations of internal
The availability of calibration data is checked
- during initialization of the line card
- at the execution of each MELT test
- This alarm may be raised in addition to
sheMeltPortCalibrationAlarm may be raised at the same time
sheMeltPortCalibrationAlarm are mutually exclusive on a

Summary.eval: ($v4==5) ? 'MELT card calibration data is available' : 'MELT card calibration data is not available'
